intro: Vincetoxicum lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false bindweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces distinctive, waxy, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Vincetoxicum lanceolatum is known for its ornamental value in gardens but can be invasive in certain regions.
